posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked:
Our robot has been seemingly ignoring PP autos whenever we run them, specifically the drivetrain (other commands in autos, like elevator scoring, etc.) Here is a video of it happening during a match, the intended path was straight forward at a SLOW speed into the reef, then place (I am sure that it was properly selected and that the gyro was zeroed)

PP path:

We did have issues with our gyro heading this competition, but we fixed those issues and when we test our PP autos at our school we have the exact same issue as in the YT video.

During competition, we ran this same path for almost the whole time, but it worked once (I dont have a video), and when testing at home we also had our paths work once. We didnt change any code between when it worked and when it didnt, and I couldn’t see anything different between the two.

Anyone have any ideas?

code

Let me know if you need any more resources, I have a few more videos of it not working and can take more.

link_counts.title: GitHub - Liberty-Hill-High-School-Robotics/2025-8088-Main: Main code for 2025 FRC season - team 8088

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: Is this with or without vision updating the odometry?

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked: We have a function to update odo. using vision, but i’m not sure if its actually updating atm, I will check and get back to you

posts.name: Alex Tsekhansky
posts.cooked:
Yes, we saw something identical and we discovered last night that if you use CTR template and  PP, it seems PP does not update the odometry before you start.

Moreover, if your odometry shows you’re too far from start point, PP will run to it.

That would make PP essentially to go into random direction after starting.

Our solution was to manually do resetPose a few times and a wait before we start actual driving.

I have a post about it on CD as well.

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked: We have resetPose and a reset gyro function(s) at the start of our autos, but as @icemannie asked, we might be accidently updating with vision pose Do you have a link to this CD post?

posts.name: Alex Tsekhansky
posts.cooked:
My post is

CTR Swerve Template and PathPlanner - odometry reset frequently is not working Technical

No replies yet

link_counts.title: CTR Swerve Template and PathPlanner - odometry reset frequently is not working

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked: Yep, found the issue: Our vision pose estimator was sending tag relative poses to our pose estimator, which explains why it was working sometimes. Thanks @icemannie and @atsekhan for helping
